content.description: A great warm up problem with a fun top out.  Has a big reach for the crux at the bottom
content.location: second route from the left on the Bird Nest Boulder

content.description:
A V4 boulder problem that can be top-roped, straight up the face, that crosses

Bird Nest Traverse

.  The crux is two 5.11d moves, but the short 12 ft of climbing make a V4 rating more appropriate.

Begin low in the center of the face, hit two horizontal slots, throw to a high left slot (crux), and finish through a V3 top out to the bolts.
content.protection: TR from two aging bolts and/or protect with a crash pad.
content.location:
Center line up the face to the bolts, through horizontal mail-slots. Crosses up over

Bird Nest Traverse

bouldering problem.

Head from the parking directly north about 200 feet, up slightly sloped sandstone to Suburban Mailbox (Choss Tower will be just to your right).

content.description: Easy warm up boulder problem that is more fun than it looks.  The holds are fine and the top out isn't too bad. It has an easy bail for inexperienced climbers who chicken out on the top out.
content.location: Far left side of the Bird Nest Boulder

content.description: awesome problem that shares a start with Suburban Mailbox and moves left after the crux.  Crux is a fun throw within the first few moves on the bottom and leads to a nice top out.
content.location: middle of the bird nest boulder and shares start with suburban mailbox

content.description: Awesome problem with enjoyable bottom moves through positive holds and crimps to a super fun throw of a crux.
content.location: Route starts on the right bottom of the boulder (same as traverse).  Start first few moves going left and follow with a big throw to the right and up.

content.description: It must be named this for a reason! Holds are not as smooth as the other traverses.
content.location: First major traverse boulder problem you see from the parking lot off of the loop.

content.description: Pockets and friction to the top up the middle of this pillar.
content.protection: TR. Couple of bolts on top. Can (should?) be backed up with slings.
content.location: Visible from the main parking lot on the Pioneer Park Road.

content.description: Right to left traverse on overhanging rock. I don't know the grade so I have left it as V0 for now.
content.protection: I have actually seen a group top rope this off what appeared to be a single bolt (whatever).
content.location: Seen just behind and to the left of Choss Tower from parking lot on the loop.

content.description: Stay right of the arete the whole way through. Goes from solid huecos to shallow ledges. Pay attention to your feet and you'll be fine.
content.protection:
For top rope, 3-4 foot slings are necessary. There are two bolts up top to connect to, but make sure you are equalizing your anchors properly.

It can be led with a small rack. Chossy sandy stone, so make sure the rock is dry.
content.location: Right of Choss Tower (5.10a). Â Same start, but uses only the right side of the arete.
